title: What are some philosophical arguments for accepting absurdity? - Quora

response.answer_text: The question, as currently presented: “What are some philosophical arguments for accepting absurdity?” Absurdity can be deemed most “acceptable” when the most ridiculous of life’s experiences has a rational and orderly relationship to human life; thus, as an amateur philosopher, I will argue that the greatest philosophical argument for accepting absurdity is found in the experience of eliminating human waste. Everyone poops; therefore, everyone is an experienced pooper. Nothing is more absurd than to have to poop waste out of one’s butt; therefore, everyone should be able to agree that humans have learned to accept the absurdity of pooping. It may be the best philosophical argument for accepting absurdity that exists among humans (and, if animals could reason, they would have to agree, too).

There are no arguments for accepting absurdity, only for accepting the seemingly absurd that, given more thought, turns out not to be absurd at all. This is what’s known as a type of paradox: a seeming contradiction that, upon deeper reflection, turns out to be no contradiction at all.
